column3: I hope this series isn't done. It's been such an insightful view on how this sport is changing and evolving through the lens of some its most interesting and charismatic athletes.

Almost 72. I don't race. I just mtn bike for fun. My fun ride being the Vermont 50. This video is inspirational. My best to the three EF riders. May their future continue to bring bring them joy in their life and riding. Thank you for sharing.

somehow it makes me, joe-blow-slow-bike-rider, feel like i have this connection to these elite athletes. how is that possible? many thanks for the inspiration and just....humility and honesty expressed by emily, lachlan, and alex.
This is fucking awesome.
WOW! Very well made! Thank You!Would've absolutely eaten up another 3 hours for sure!
Really enjoyed this.
Pure road biker but loved this, might have to give mountain biking a go?
Inspirational.

Beautiful shots and great editing but feel cheated if the end, it just felt like it abruptly stopped and I’m left wondering the purpose of the video. What was the conclusion and what does the future look like for these riders?
You guys inspire me so much! I hope to see more of the three of you riding and racing in 2023
Absolutely love this series. Keep them coming, please!
This was a great watch, short yeah but very good. Hope to see them in the near future
Gravel people are the new surfers.

I just want to send the whole crew, directors, supporters, graphic designers and of course the athletes a lot of love & admiration from Germany. In May I got a thrombosis in my shoulder for no apparent reason and was pretty devastated. I discovered this series through forced time off the bike, but was able to slowly claw my way back into full training. Am now fully back to shredding centuries with efforts and beating records on climbs in Switzerland. You guys were a huge support throughout the year. Keep up the great work :) THANK YOU SO MUCH!! 🙏🙏🙏❤‍🩹
Solid performances from all 3 despite the obstacles they came across in several races. Some recognition of who the winners of the series would've been good.
Awesome
BIG respect Emily, Alex and Lachy
On a positive note... love how it's film in wide format... thanks, nice touch.

I'm going to provide a counterpoint to all of the lavish praise in the comments. One reason cycling is dying is that there are not enough aspirational figures in the sport. An "aw shucks," self-deprecating dorkiness permeates the culture. The men at the forefront of the sport do not exactly embody the hard-nosed, badass masculinity like an Armstrong did, or to compare to other sports, a Lebron or Ronaldo or Tom Brady. These cyclists would get eaten by those other sportsmen. And for better or worse, LA back in the day wouldn't... his vibe was totally different, and an entire generation was attracted to that. Alex and Lachlan are super chill, likeable guys. But kids watching this are not going to leave thinking "wow, cycling is super badass!" like they feel after watching a Nike commercial about myriad other sports. It's too bad because cycling is a pretty badass sport.
God Bless you for the memory dedications. Never forgotten.
This has been a great series.  Take advantage of all the content and make more video’s.  Iove what EF is doing and the riders.  Met Alex and Lachlan at Chequamegon.  Class acts and great ambassadors!

So great, loved every minute of it. Been watching Alex and Lachi for many years as an EF fan. Cheering all three of y’all on for next year. Come to Roanoke,VA and we’ll taking u riding!

Kudos to EF and Rapha et al for supporting this effort. And even more to Emily, Alex,and Lachlan for their world-class talents/accomplishment .... and their willingness to share the sacrifices, agony, and dedication it takes to compete at any level, much less theirs. Also for sharing the personal and family insights that show their humanity and life perspectives.  Well done!

Thank you. I've fallen out of love with cycling since I had an illness. This film has helped me get back in the saddle. It just needed to be longer.. 😎❤
